en.kap3: It is Europa777's policy that all staff members actively participate in preventing Europa777's services from being exploited by criminals and terrorists for money laundering purposes or used to finance a terrorist activity through winnings obtained through wagering on the company's website.
en.kap4: This participation has the following objectives:
en.kap5: ensure the compliance of Europa777 with all applicable laws, statutory regulatory instruments and requirements of the relevant supervisory body protect the company and all of its employees as individuals from the risks associated with violations of the law, regulations, and supervisory requirements preserve the good name of Europa777 against the risk of damage to reputation presented by involvement in money laundering and terrorist financing activities contribute positively to the fight against crime and terrorism.
en.kap6: To achieve these goals, it is Europa777's policy that:
en.kap7: every employee must fulfill his personal obligations as appropriate to his function and position in the company.
en.kap8: Commercial considerations will never take precedence over Europa777's anti-money laundering commitments.
en.kap9: the company shall appoint a Money Laundering Reporting Officer (MLRO) and a designated staff member to provide continuity during their absence, and shall have the full assistance and cooperation of all staff members in performing the duties of their appointments.
en.kap10: Any reference to the MLRO in this document shall include the designated staff member in the event that the MLRO is temporarily absent.
en.kap12: Europa777 believes that before implementing its Fraud Management Procedure, it is essential to identify what is, on the one hand, money laundering, and what, on the other hand, constitutes terrorist financing.
en.kap13: Money laundering is the movement or concealment of proceeds of crime in order to cover up the connection between the crime and the funds generated, so as to benefit from the proceeds of crime. Thus, the ultimate goal is to cover up the source of funds.
en.kap14: Terrorist financing is the process of providing funds or other assets, directly or indirectly, to terrorist groups or individual terrorists to support them in their operations.
en.kap15: This can occur through funds from legitimate sources or a combination of legal and illegal sources.
en.kap16: In fact, funding from legal sources is a key difference between terrorist organizations and traditional criminal organizations involved in money laundering operations.
en.kap17: While it seems logical that funding from legitimate sources need not be laundered, there is often a need for terrorists to cover up or disguise the links between the organization, or the individual terrorist, and its legitimate sources of funding.
en.kap20: In accordance with applicable laws, Europa777 adopts a risk-based approach.
en.kap21: Thus, it identifies and analyzes its risks and subsequently makes use of measures, policies, controls and procedures to curb any undesired risks, among which those related to the risks of money laundering and terrorist financing materialize.
en.kap22: The approach allows for significant flexibility and discretion to be exercised by Europa777.
en.kap23: That in itself implies significant responsibility.
en.kap24: It is incumbent upon Europa777 to demonstrate through appropriate documentation, including but not limited to a risk analysis process, that it has assessed all risks and adequately implemented all measures to control those risks.
en.kap25: In this regard, this policy sets out the specific steps that Europa777 will take to ensure that its conduct is aligned with the Risk-Based Approach with respect to the consideration and identification of risks directly affecting money laundering and terrorist financing.
en.kap28: (i) recognition of the existence of risk
en.kap30: (iii) implement systems and strategies to manage and control the identified risks.
en.kap31: There is no doubt that the remote gambling business is considered risky.
en.kap32: However, the risk assessment will identify the main risks that the company faces, as well as the level of those risks, so that consequently the necessary measures can be taken to manage and control the identified risks.
en.kap33: This procedure will specify the controls and processes that must be followed to ensure that the risks Europa777 has identified and will face as part of its operations do not materialize.
en.kap34: Europa777's organizational risk assessment which must be approved by the Board of Directors, takes into account the following factors:
en.kap36: Some game products/services/transactions are more vulnerable to criminal exploitation than others. These include, for example, gaming products or services that allow a customer to influence the outcome of a game, either a player alone or in collusion with others.
en.kap38: Refers to the channel through which Europa777 establishes a business relationship and/or through which transactions are carried out.

en.kap40: Europa777 will adopt a good mix of verification methods based on documents and electronic sources as mentioned below, to counter the mentioned risks.
en.kap41: For example, although Europa777 makes use of electronic databases, it is aware that databases only confirm that the identification details provided correspond to those of a real person, and not that the customer is actually that individual.
en.kap42: Providing additional identification documents will provide further evidence that Europa777 was justified in considering that the Customer is indeed the person he claims to be.
en.kap44: This is the risk posed to Europa777 by the geographical location of customers, but also the geographical location of its suppliers and service providers.
en.kap45: The element to be considered in connection with this fraud management procedure is mainly attributable to customers and the origin of their funds.
en.kap46: A customer's nationality, residence and place of birth must be taken into consideration, as these may be indicative of a high geographical risk.
en.kap47: Also on terrorism faction - countries that are known to suffer from a significant level of corruption, countries subject to international sanctions related to terrorism or the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction, will be considered high risk.
en.kap48: The opposite is also true and therefore they may be considered medium or low risk.
en.kap50: These assessments must be constantly reassessed as new risks emerge.
en.kap51: Risks may arise due to changes in technology, which may facilitate money laundering or the financing of terrorism attempts.
en.kap52: Other changes include broadening the customer base or adding games and payment methods that present a different risk profile than those already offered, which will require a review of the business risk analysis.
en.kap53: In such changes, Europa777 will reassess business risks at least once a year to analyze whether any changes are necessary.
en.kap54: When determining the level of risk posed by a customer, the accumulation of all indicators will be taken into account. Together, these determine the player's risk profile.
en.kap56: Refers to the type of customer to whom the service is provided.
en.kap57: The assessment of the risk posed by an individual is generally based on the economic activity and/or source of wealth of the individual.
en.kap58: In identifying the level of risk inherent in a relationship, Europa777 will assess what the likelihood would be that a client could launder the proceeds of crime through Europa777's service.
en.kap59: A high earning client who spends a quarter of his monthly salary on gambling is not likely to constitute high risk, even if the amount wagered is large.
en.kap60: On the other hand, a minimum wage earner who spends his only salary on gambling is likely to constitute a high risk.
en.kap61: In addition, the individual will be screened to determine if they are a politically exposed person (PEP), or in any way associated with a PEP.
en.kap62: Checks would also be conducted to ensure that the individual is not subject to any sanctions or other statutory measures.
en.kap65: The Fraud Management Procedure will now focus on the procedure of getting to know the customer and identifying the risks related to their transactions and the origin of their funds, both where the funds were obtained from and the source of the funds.
en.kap66: As described above, a risk assessment can never be a one-size-fits-all exercise.
en.kap67: Europa777 will, in this respect, conduct a risk assessment when entering into a business relationship or performing for a client.
en.kap68: For the purpose of clarity, Europa777 will not accept corporate players, only individual players.
en.kap69: The aforementioned risk assessment will allow Europa777 to develop a risk profile in relation to the customer and to classify the risk as low, medium or high, thus allowing it to identify the controls that need to be adopted.
en.kap70: The player's risk profile will not be filled in at the time of registration.
en.kap71: The registration part of the process will only mean the start of information gathering, so the risk profile will be increased and improved as the relationship with the player develops.
en.kap72: In what implies the change in the identified risk, the measures taken to control the risk should be adapted accordingly. In addition, continuous monitoring, as explained in more detail below, will ensure that any change in risk is detected as soon as possible.
en.kap73: The level of monitoring will be proportional to the risk presented by the particular customer, but systems will be in place to detect developing risk situations.
en.kap74: To begin with Europa777 adopts CDD measures to determine who its customers are. All details collected in the registration phase are used to build the customer profile and also on the particular behavioral aspects.
en.kap75: This profiling aspect will help determine the risk associated with the particular player and thus also facilitate the identification of future unusual behavior.
en.kap76: The CDD is divided into the following three parts:
en.kap78: Identification consists of collecting the player's personal data. This information is collected during the registration process. The personal information collected is to initiate the Know Your Client (KYC) procedure, which includes the collection of the following personal data:
en.kap81: c. Date of birth, as the player must be over the age of eighteen (or any other age as applicable in the player's specific jurisdiction)
en.kap85: g. Identity reference number, where applicable.
en.kap86: Once the above information is provided, Europa777 will first check whether the individual in question is a Politically Exposed Person (PEP), a family member of the PEP or a close business partner of the PEP.
en.kap87: A trusted electronic database, such as opensanctions.org and complianceadvantage.com will be integrated and used for this purpose.
en.kap88: If it is determined that an individual is a PEP or in any way related to a PEP, the individual will be considered a PEP himself/herself and will not be able to register as a player with Europa777, as Europa777 has a strict policy of not accepting PEPs as players.
en.kap89: This means, therefore, that the determination of whether an individual is a PEP (as defined above) will take place at the registration stage.
en.kap90: The account will be formally opened as soon as the player's e-mail is verified.
en.kap91: In any situation where the player is immediately identified as high risk, Europa777 may immediately request additional personal details and verification of these.
en.kap92: In any case, Europa777 will ensure that it is always able to determine that the customer is who he claims to be and that the measures taken are effective enough to neutralize the risk of identity fraud and impersonation.
en.kap93: Verification consists in confirming the personal data collected for identification purposes through the use of independent data, information and documentation obtained from reliable sources.
en.kap94: If inconsistencies are identified in the personal information provided by the customer, Europa777 will consider additional identification and verification measures.
en.kap95: This will occur in two ways:
en.kap97: As a rule, this method of verification will be performed by referring to government issued documents that contain a photographic image together with the player's identity (e.g. passport, ID card, driver's license).
en.kap98: If the player's home address cannot be verified using any of the documents mentioned, Europa777 will request reliable alternative documents such as a recent utility bill, bank account statements, correspondence from the government or public entities, etc. in order to be able to verify.
en.kap99: The requested documents will be received by e-mail and if deemed necessary, notarized documents may be requested.
en.kap100: Europa777 will ensure that all documents received are clear, legible, of good quality, and are authentic or reflect authenticity.
en.kap101: Some documents, such as passports, may be easier to verify because they can be compared to others. In other cases, such as utility bills, the verification process may be less easy.
en.kap102: Europa777 will perform additional verifications using specific software programs/applications that will be integrated as a solution to help perform the work.
en.kap103: In connection with the validity of the information provided, Europa777 will also consider other data collected from the player, such as geographical location, IP address data, etc., which should under normal circumstances corroborate the data contained in the documents provided by the player.
en.kap104: There will be exceptions, where the IP address will not match the country/location. Such instances would need to be verified on a case by case basis and verification/clarification will be obtained directly from the player.
en.kap106: They include sources like E-ID or Bank-ID and commercial electronic databases.
en.kap107: Europa777 is aware that the reliability of these databases is not always optimal.
en.kap108: In this respect, it will consider which source of information is being fed into the database and whether this data is generally known to be kept up-to-date.
en.kap109: When making use of the electronic databases mentioned, Europa777 will also make use of other documentary evidence for better confirmation/reliability.
en.kap110: This is because a positive result in the electronic database will only mean that there is a person whose personal data match those provided by the customer, but not that the customer is that person.
en.kap111: On the other hand, when using electronic sources such as E-ID and ID-Bank, which can only be accessed through the use of a specific individual's credentials, no additional means of verification will be requested because these sources are considered a sufficiently strong link.
en.kap112: B. Obtaining information about the purpose and intended nature of the business relationship.
en.kap113: The purpose behind opening a gambling account is quite obvious and therefore no clarification will be requested as to why an account opening request was made.
en.kap114: However, there may be an ulterior motive in which the account was opened, possibly for money laundering or terrorist financing.
en.kap115: If Europa777 has any suspicion that such an ulterior motive subsists, then it will conduct a further investigation and request additional data and documentation to justify its suspicions or further to confirm that, in fact, there are no justifiable indications of an illegal motive.
en.kap116: There is no specific time frame or period in which these additional checks will be performed, as they will simply be performed when the suspicion arises.
en.kap117: Therefore, the investigation may need to be conducted at the registry, while at others they need to be carried out until the specific mandatory AML thresholds are reached.
en.kap118: In case any checks are performed before the mandatory period, Europa777 will first collect sufficient information and, where necessary, documentation to establish the player's source of wealth.
en.kap119: Source of wealth consists of determining the activities that generate the player's net worth, which will lead Europa777 to determine whether this amount of wealth justifies its projected and actual level of account activity, and whether the player is within the risk matrix (as per the table in the next section).
en.kap120: When the risk determined after the checks is medium or low, Europa777 will accept a statement from the customer with details such as the nature of the job/business and a statement about the annual salary.
en.kap121: Surveys on professional networks and social media will also be used for verification purposes.
en.kap122: If the risk is high or Europa777 has doubts about the veracity of the information collected, the player will be asked to provide further independent and reliable documentation proving the alleged source of wealth.
en.kap123: So, for example, the individual may be asked to submit a copy of his/her payroll or provide any other documented evidence to confirm his/her statement.
en.kap125: This ultimately involves monitoring customers' transactions, personal details, and changes in their circumstances or betting preferences - to ensure that they are consistent with anticipated activity and if not, to identify why the changes have occurred.
en.kap126: The aim is to identify and analyze subjectively unusual large transactions, changes in gambling patterns and other 'unusual' activity.
en.kap127: In this regard, it is important for Europa777 to ensure that player information is kept up to date.
en.kap128: This will encourage and even obligate players, through the terms and conditions, to inform Europa777 of any changes and possibly provide documentation to confirm them.
en.kap129: Through the monitoring process, the level of risk will be analyzed and an analysis will be made as to whether the previously established risk rating should be changed or not.
en.kap130: Any inconsistencies in the information would need to be justified and Europa777 reserves the right to request further corroborative evidence.
en.kap131: Proper ongoing monitoring also involves carefully examining the player's transactions and gambling patterns to ensure that they are aligned with Europa777's knowledge of the player, his gambling activity and risk profile.
en.kap132: If the two do not coincide, Europa777 will question the situation in the same way.
en.kap133: Whenever Europa777 requests further information, it will always take note of its findings to prove its compliance.
en.kap134: Should any identified inconsistency persist without being successfully resolved, Europa777.
en.kap135: Europa777 will consider whether any report should be submitted to the competent authorities and will also take a decision whether it considers it necessary to suspend the player's account.
en.kap136: Finally, with regard to PEPs, a scenario may arise where a player may not have been considered a PEP at the registration stage, but becomes one during the business relationship.
en.kap137: If Europa777 becomes aware of such a change, Europa777 will terminate its business relationship as it has a strict policy of not accepting PEPs as players.
en.kap138: If, for some reason or other, the individual has not been identified as a PEP, even if they were a PEP at the registration stage, but are consequently identified as such, Europa777 will void any winnings earned by the individual.
en.kap139: It will then transfer the deposited funds to the original source from which the funds came. Consequently, it will close the player's account, as per the procedure described in section 3.3 below.
en.kap140: 3.2 Time and application of CDD measures
en.kap141: As described above, the player's account will be successfully opened once the player has registered by providing the basic personal information requested.
en.kap142: The system is set up to prevent minors from registering by rejecting any date of birth entered that means the player is under eighteen years of age (or any other age as per specific legislation - such as Latvia - 21 years of age).
en.kap143: Verification of any player details (with the exception of WBS confirmations) may take place at any time at the discretion of Europa777.
en.kap144: However, at the very least, it should definitely be carried out when the amount deposited by players reaches the cumulative amount of €1,000. It makes no difference whether these deposits were made through a single transaction or several transactions which appear to be linked or not.
en.kap145: Europa777 will therefore implement a system that calculates on a daily basis whether the player has reached the deposit limit of €1,000 in his account.
en.kap146: Another important factor that the system will include is the identification of possible multiple accounts, whose accounts would have been created specifically to defraud the company through bonus abuse or specifically to never reach the required deposit limit of €1,000 and therefore ensure that the account remains in verification.
en.kap147: Until such time as this limit is reached, Europa777 will carry out continuous monitoring in accordance with Section 3.1 C above to ensure that the player's information is still correct.
en.kap148: In addition, if Europa777 notifies Europa777 at any time of inconsistencies between the information provided by the player and any other information acquired, Europa777 will question the discrepancies and take any corrective action it deems necessary.
en.kap149: In addition, if it suspects money laundering or terrorist financing, it will follow the procedure set out in section 4 below.
en.kap150: Once this threshold has been reached, the player's risk profile will be confirmed on the basis of the risk assessment carried out under 2.2 above.Furthermore, if thirty days have elapsed since the EUR 1,000 threshold has been reached and the player has not provided the requested information and/or documentation, Europa777 may terminate the business relationship with the player by following the procedure set out in the next section.
en.kap154: Ongoing monitoring is performed to ensure that the relationship remains low risk and the limit is not exceeded again

en.kap174: All approval for such action must be taken by senior management and only after verifying that there is no restriction on the transfer of funds.
en.kap175: If Europa777 finds it impossible to return the funds to the player through the same channels, it will, as a last resort, send the funds to a single account held at a credit or financial institution in a reputable jurisdiction in the player's name.
en.kap176: Once that account is made available, the funds will continue to be held in the players name.
en.kap177: The funds will continue to be held in the account until the player provides the appropriate details for the transfer.
en.kap178: If this never materializes then, after the course of 30 months, any remaining funds in the account will be remitted to the Malta Gaming Authority (CURACAO GAMING AUTHORITY).
en.kap179: Whenever sending such funds, Europa777 will indicate in the instructions accompanying the funds that they are being sent due to the inability to complete the CDD. Europa777 will also consider whether there are for the filing of a Suspicious Transaction Report (STR), as per the procedure set forth below.
en.kap181: Europa777 will also conduct due diligence exercises before establishing any business relationships with third parties.
en.kap182: These exercises will be carried out by senior management in conjunction with the legal department and the MLRO. Like CDD, commercial due diligence (BDD) will seek to identify what risks would arise if Europa777 were to engage in business with third parties.
en.kap183: In performing this assessment, it will be determined whether the source, nature and volume of business to be introduced through the third party, Europa777 will also give much weight to whether a supplier is already an approved supplier in accordance with the requirements of the GAMING AUTHORITY CURE.
en.kap184: It is also considered positive if a supplier who is not currently approved seeks approval at the time of contracting with Europa777.
en.kap185: The evaluation will also seek to establish whether the third party has business dealings with other third parties that are known to be non-respectable, or whether the third party conducts its business in a non-respectable jurisdiction.
en.kap186: In this regard, Europa777 will ask the third party to provide it with originals/certified copies of all necessary documentation, including, certificate of incorporation of the company, memorandum and articles of association, certificate of good standing, annual financial statements, identification of officers of the company, as well as a list of shareholders and a bank reference letter, confirming that the company's business is handled properly.
en.kap187: Once it is determined that the third party conducts business in a manner that does not harm Europa777's position, the parties will agree to the terms of the business relationship and sign the relevant agreements and documentation.
en.kap188: As part of the BDD, Europa777 will conduct ongoing monitoring to ensure that the third party still conducts its business in a diligent manner, based on its own experience of the manner in which services are provided.
en.kap189: In addition, Europa777 also reserves the right to include an Audit Right clause in the contract it enters into with the third party, if deemed necessary.
en.kap190: Any anti-money laundering analysis performed will be noted separately in the third party's file.
en.kap191: In any case, Europa777 will always reserve the right to terminate its business relationship with any third party if it considers that, by conducting business with the third party, it is jeopardizing compliance with its anti-money laundering and terrorist financing obligations.
en.kap193: Europa777 may decide to rely on the information and documentation collected at the customer onboarding stage by a third party and/or hire an agent.
en.kap194: In either case, Europa777 will ensure that the third party is established in an EU Member State or a reputable jurisdiction that adopts the same anti-money laundering or anti-terrorist financing measures as provided for in the applicable Maltese legislation, or measures that are equivalent to it. Europa777 will rely on reputable sources such as the Financial Action Task Force on Money Laundering Assessment Reports, IMFCountryReportsetc.
en.kap195: If Europa777 decides to rely on information provided by third parties, it may still request the player to provide any verification documents. In such circumstances, Europa777 will still conduct its own risk assessment, determine the customer's risk rating and conduct ongoing monitoring.
en.kap196: The relationship between Europa777 and the third party will be set out in an agreement, and one of the conditions will be that the third party will provide Europa777 with documents relating to the players, immediately upon request.
en.kap197: Europa777 will also include a Right to Audit clause in the agreement and will, in fact, periodically test this agreement to ensure that the necessary personal data and player documentation is collected according to the agreed specifications.
en.kap198: A copy of this procedure will also be provided to the third party to ensure that the CDD requirements and applicable limits are properly communicated so that the third party will never have the excuse that they were not aware of what requirements apply to the company. Europa777 may, where permitted by law, elect to use the services of agents to ship or service customers.
en.kap199: Europa777 may require the agent to perform the necessary anti-money laundering/combating the financing of terrorism controls and taking measures when boarding or servicing one of Europa777's clients. In any event, however, Europa777 will ensure that any application of CDD measures is carried out diligently and as required by applicable laws.
en.kap200: Europa777 is well aware that, when exercising trust or making use of agents, it remains responsible for ensuring that it is adhering to its anti-money laundering/combating terrorist financing obligations.
en.kap202: 4.1 Appointment of the Money Laundering Reporting Officer (MLRO)
en.kap203: While a detailed description of the MLRO's responsibilities is set out in the Human Resources Roles and Responsibilities Policy, the MLRO's primary responsibility will be to consider any internal reports of unusual or suspicious transactions that are raised within the company, following up on such reports and also filing an STR with the Financial Intelligence Analysis Unit (FIAU) when deemed necessary, the MLRO will also act as the primary channel through which any communications with the FIAU will be conducted.
en.kap204: He will ensure that Europa777 is effectively implementing the policies and procedures it has adopted to address its anti-money laundering/combating terrorist financing obligations. The MLRO will be responsible for monitoring any updates on sanctions.
en.kap205: Lists such as those of the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) and the Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC).
en.kap206: He will then update the rest of the team on any amendments to the sanctions lists and any fundamental changes in applicable law.
en.kap207: Europa777 will ensure that the individual appointed as MLRO has sufficient seniority and command to be able to act independently of its management.
en.kap208: The MLRO shall have access to all necessary information/documentation and company employees to effectively perform its duties.
en.kap209: Europa777 has also appointed a designated employee who may act as MLRO during the absence of the MLRO.
en.kap210: The MLRO's, as well as the appointments of the designated employees, will be informed to the GAMING AUTHORITY, so that the GAMING AUTHORITY, as well as the FIAU, can address inquiries and requests directly to them, whenever necessary. The individuals will act as a point of contact between Europa777 and the relevant authorities in matters related to money laundering/terrorist financing suppression.
en.kap212: Europa777 may develop a suspicion or have reasonable grounds to suspect that activity in an account is linked to money laundering or terrorist financing.
en.kap213: At that time, Europa777 will ensure that all CDD requirements are met, regardless of whether any applicable threshold has been met.
en.kap214: Consequently, it will send an STR as soon as possible.
en.kap216: As detailed in section 6 below, all employees who communicate with players or have access to information about client matters will receive anti-money laundering training.
en.kap217: Identify the action of which player should reasonably lead him to suspect that money laundering or the financing of terrorist activity is being attempted or has taken place.
en.kap218: For example, he is expected to notice that if a player attempts to register more than one account with Europa777, or if he deposits considerable amounts during a single session via multiple prepaid cards, such actions should constitute indicators or red flags that should cause him to question the player's behavior.
en.kap219: Seek explanations from the player, without disclosing your suspicion to the player.
en.kap220: Such disclosure is prohibited directly or indirectly, and therefore all members who have access to the material should be astute in this regard.
en.kap221: If the officer cannot obtain any convincing information and after a thorough analysis, the officer still suspects foul play, then he should inform his superior immediately.
en.kap222: Obviously, before reporting to his superior, the employee will have to be convinced that there is a clear indication of intent to circumvent safeguards and that the use of the financial system for criminal purposes is present.
en.kap223: There may be cases where the manager disagrees with the officer, but the officer still feels that he has reasonable grounds to suspect wrongdoing.
en.kap224: In such circumstances, the officer should inform the MLRO of his suspicions anyway.
en.kap225: The officer may discuss the matter directly with the MLRO and is in no way obligated to inform or involve his manager.
en.kap226: Upon receipt of the employee's internal report, the MLRO will acknowledge its receipt in writing, referring to the report by its date and unique file number, without including the name of the suspected person(s). In this way, the employee's legal obligation to report will be considered fulfilled.
en.kap227: The employee may only discuss the matter internally with management or other employees, if deemed necessary, after obtaining approval from the MLRO.
en.kap228: Any external discussions are prohibited and will be considered a whistleblower.
en.kap229: If circumstances arise that make it difficult for the employee to communicate with the player without risking any possibility of whistleblowing, the employee should seek advice and follow the MLRO's instructions. This procedure will constitute Europa777's internal procedure for reporting suspicious activities and transactions.
en.kap231: As already described in the previous section, the MLRO must receive and evaluate internal suspicion reports.
en.kap232: He will open and maintain a log detailing the progress related to each report, noting all information that needs to be documented to ensure that a proper record is maintained of the reasons for his decision.
en.kap233: Such documentation may also be used to assist the Authorities in any analysis or investigation of suspected money laundering or terrorist financing, when such details are requested directly from the MLRO.
en.kap234: This record shall be maintained by and be accessible only to the MLRO and shall not form part of the player's file.
en.kap235: The MLRO shall gather all necessary information and ask questions of any of Europa777's employees as part of its investigation. The employees (whether those who filed the internal report or not) must provide the MLRO with the relevant information.
en.kap236: In doing so, they will not be violating their customer confidentiality obligation.
en.kap237: Once the MLRO decides that there are reasonable grounds justifying the submission of an STR through the Authority's online submission system, it must make this formal disclosure to the FIAU on behalf of Europa777.
en.kap238: No copies of internal or external reports will be made. The MLRO shall keep these records secure. The MLRO shall, where appropriate, inform the author of the internal report whether or not a formal disclosure has been made.
en.kap239: Following a formal disclosure, the MLRO shall take the steps required by the Authorities in connection with the disclosure and shall accordingly follow their instructions.
en.kap240: 4.2.3 What should give rise to suspicious activity?
en.kap241: For the sake of clarity, STR reports will cover:
en.kap242: Any activity that leads Europa777 to think that a person is connected with money laundering/terrorist financing or any proceeds of crime, or that either is being committed, or may be committed, regardless of whether or not any transaction has taken place.
en.kap243: Any case in which objective facts will lead Europa777 to have reasonable grounds to suspect that money laundering/financing of terrorism or the proceeds of crime may be taking place.
en.kap244: Europa777 will be required to file an STR with the FIAU regarding the activity performed on the basis of its Curacao gaming license, and to notify the CURAÇAO GAMING AUTHORITY as it deems necessary and in accordance with the instructions given by the FIAU.
en.kap246: Due to the nature of the gaming products and services offered by Europa777 and the nature of the transactions in question, Europa777 will not always be in a position to refrain from carrying out a pending transaction prior to the filing of an STR.
en.kap247: This is because, should Europa777 refrain from accepting a transaction when it usually does so instantly, the delay in acceptance may lead the player to know that he is being suspected of fraudulent activity.
en.kap248: Any delay may prejudice an analysis or investigation of the suspected transaction.
en.kap249: Therefore, whenever Europa777 suspects money laundering/terrorist financing, Europa777 will continue to execute the suspected transaction.
en.kap250: However, Europa777 will submit an STR to the FIAU immediately after the execution of the transaction.
en.kap252: ✓ Disclosures to the Supervisory Authority, in this case the GAMING AUTHORITY CURACAO;
en.kap253: ✓ Disclosures between subjects in the same group;
en.kap254: ✓ Disclosure of losses between a person carrying out a 'relevant activity' and another person carrying out similar activities, or where jurisdiction imposes similar requirements. Persons who are in the same legal entity or within a larger structure to which they belong, who have common ownership and management;
en.kap255: ✓ Sharing information based on the same transaction, persons and the connected activity that are subject to the same legal obligations and persons who are of the same professional category and therefore have similar obligations with regard to professional secrecy and Data Protection;
en.kap256: ✓ Disclosures by a subject in the course of an initiated proceeding related to delays in performing transactions, where the subject was actually following instructions pursuant to FIAU;
en.kap257: ✓ Disclosure by a person subject to a supervisory authority, as requested by the supervisory authority, in this regard, to GAMING AUTHORITY CURE.
en.kap258: Europa777 will also carefully consider any of the actions it decides to take with respect to the suspected player following the submission of an STR.
en.kap259: In order not to compromise any investigation, before taking any such action, Europa777 will seek guidance from FIAU analysts. Europa777 will, to the extent possible, consider such actions as a measure of last resort and will not unnecessarily burden the FIAU with all minor suspicions.
en.kap260: Of minor suspicions that do not warrant notification, it will increase continuous monitoring and only send COSs to the FIAU when the suspicion persists or the indicators increase. Europa777 will ensure proper documentation of such internal decision-making.
en.kap262: Whenever a player makes a withdrawal request, regardless of the payment method used, Europa777 will, before accepting such a request, make sure that the institution to which the funds are to be sent is situated in a reputable jurisdiction and has equivalent anti-money laundering/fake terrorism requirements applicable to Europa777.
en.kap263: Obviously, this is also tied to the institutions from which players' deposits are accepted. As a general rule, withdrawals will be processed only to the same source from which the funds originated.
en.kap264: This measure will limit the risk of successful money laundering or financing of terrorist withdrawals.
en.kap265: Also, no cash deposits or withdrawals will be affected. Withdrawal requests will be handled according to the following procedure:
en.kap266: ✓ Withdrawal requests will be processed immediately upon request.
en.kap267: ✓ No cash withdrawals can be processed under any circumstances. Cash transactions are specifically prohibited and in fact, there are no methods that players can apply to process any cash fund transfers.
en.kap268: ✓ Gameplay will be checked as well as all financial transactions.
en.kap269: ✓ Europa777 will also consider whether individuals are playing fairly or whether the game system has been manipulated in any way, or whether the system is alternatively defective and the player was somehow taking advantage of any bug without informing Europa777 as per the requirements of the Terms and Conditions.
en.kap270: ✓ Reference will also be made to whether CDD verification has been performed. If it has not yet been performed, since the deposit requirement has not been reached, a management decision is made as to whether CDD verification needs to be performed at this stage before completing the withdrawal process.
en.kap271: ✓ Risk assessment is also performed/verified to ensure that the player's risk in relation to his activity with Europa777 is determined.
en.kap272: ✓ The applicable CDD requirements will be as per section 3.2 above.
en.kap273: ✓ If the player does not provide the necessary documents for verification when requested, or if it becomes clear that verification cannot take place because the individual acted fraudulently, the withdrawals will not be processed.
en.kap274: It is clear to Europa777 that the individual was attempting to act fraudulently, it will block the player's account, void all winnings, and simply return the deposit to the account from which the funds originated.
en.kap275: ✓ If withdrawals cannot be processed from the account from which the funds originated, such as when the player is using Mastercard or Paysafecard, Europa777 will formally request verification documents from the player and also request details of another payment system that can be confirmed as being in the player's name and therefore minimize the risk of remitting funds to an individual other than the person who originally remitted the deposits.
en.kap276: This process is in place to discourage credit card theft and identity theft.
en.kap278: It is Europa777's policy that all employees who have customer contact, or access to information about customer affairs, receive anti-money laundering training to ensure that their knowledge and understanding is at an appropriate level.
en.kap279: In addition, training will be provided at least once a year to maintain awareness and ensure that the company's legal obligations are met.
en.kap280: Any training given will take into consideration the practicality of assigning different tasks to employees according to their function and all accessible information will be in accordance to the need for knowledge.
en.kap281: However, training on the entire process will be provided to employees to ensure that each officer has an understanding of due diligence, KYC, AML and payout procedures as these are very close.
en.kap282: Taking into account the seriousness of the obligations imposed by law and regulations and the severity of the possible sanctions, ORLA will ensure that information about these obligations is available to all employees at all times.
en.kap283: It will also ensure ongoing training, i.e. whenever necessary, even based on direct requests from employees.
en.kap284: Training programs will include testing to ensure that each individual has achieved the appropriate level of knowledge and understanding.
en.kap285: Testing may be conducted in a variety of ways, whether through formal testing, assessment through discussion of case studies, or other means.
en.kap286: Special attention will be given to the training needs of senior management and compliance staff, whose knowledge and understanding must be more in-depth.
en.kap288: ✓ inform all staff members of the training programs they are required to undertake, as well as the completion schedule;
en.kap289: ✓ verify that all employees have completed their assigned training programs, issuing reminders to those who have not completed the programs as per the applicable schedule;
en.kap290: ✓ keep records of completed training, including the results of tests or other assessments that demonstrate that each individual has achieved an appropriate level of competency;
en.kap291: ✓ update employee personnel files with details of training conducted and results obtained when applicable;
en.kap292: ✓ refer to top management any cases in which team members are unresponsive or whose results are unsatisfactory, to issue reprimands or provide additional training as appropriate to the individual case.
en.kap293: The MLRO will have full access to all records maintained by the HR Department.
en.kap294: At the end of a training cycle, the HR Department will ensure that ongoing training continues and will also obtain updates from MLRO regarding changes that have occurred, for HR to ensure that refresher training is organized and provided to all team members.
en.kap295: Line managers will also provide feedback to the HR Department regarding:
en.kap296: ✓ the effectiveness of completed programs; and
en.kap297: ✓ make suggestions as to the different delivery methods.
en.kap298: Line managers will supplement the training provided to support staff by giving day-to-day guidance on:
en.kap299: ✓ the type of customer instructions and transactions that count as 'significant' and therefore should be brought to your attention
en.kap300: ✓ identify client instructions and transactions that although not normally 'significant' in nature, are in some way unusual or anomalous and should be considered, with respect to possible suspicion of money laundering or terrorist financing.
en.kap301: The MLRO will determine the training needs for his own role and ensure that he undergoes Continuing Professional Education (CPE) as required to meet his legal obligations.
en.kap302: The aim of all training provided is to ensure that staff are able to identify any attempted or actual money laundering or financing of terrorist activity carried out by players when using Europa777's services.
en.kap303: PlayGreen is using a third-party external provider for the simplified due diligence verification procedure and is not responsible for errors if an error occurs on the external provider side.
en.kap304: 7. Keep records of customer due diligence information
en.kap305: When information is being collected for CDD purposes, the responsible service team:
en.kap306: ✓ keep records in the client file.
en.kap307: ✓ record instances where the requested information was not provided or the explanations provided were not satisfactory.
en.kap308: ✓ ensure that all records are consistently maintained so that they are accessible and understandable to other authorized personnel, including the MLRO.
en.kap309: Transaction and customer records as of the date of the transaction and the termination of the business relationship, respectively, are kept as long as Europa777 has a valid legal reason to keep such records.
en.kap310: Such reasons are limited only to legal obligations that Europa777 A & More BV needs to fulfill, such as anti-money laundering obligations, tax regulations, etc.
en.kap311: The records are consequently archived. Players have the possibility to access transactions from their profile for a period of 2 months.
en.kap312: After this time, details about transactions can be requested through customer support at
en.kap313: If Europa777 determines that a player's record needs to be withheld for an extended period of time due to the fact that a report has been filed regarding that player, all relevant records will be retained in the live system and not filed.
en.kap314: This is done to ensure that Europa777 meets its anti-money laundering obligations.
en.kap315: Once the inquiry/investigation has been completed and the MLRO has been informed accordingly, the records will be treated in the same way as all other information and the same archiving policy will apply.
en.kap317: Compliance with this policy will be constantly tested and ensured.
en.kap318: The Board of Directors reserves the right to engage external auditors to verify that the company is complying with the measures set out in this procedure.
en.kap319: The results of these audits and any appropriate recommendations for action will be reported to the Board of Directors. The latter will request feedback from management regarding the suggestions made by the auditors.
en.kap320: Based on the recommendations as well as the feedback from management, the directors will make a decision on processes/procedures to be changed or introduced.
en.kap321: A timeline for implementation will also be discussed and decided upon.
en.kap322: Feedback on the implementation of any changes should be reported to the directors, as they are responsible for the company's operations.
en.kap323: The MLRO will obviously be involved and his input will be considered paramount in relation to this process.
en.kap324: He will be charged with monitoring aspects of the company's CDD and anti-money laundering policies and procedures.
en.kap325: Any deficiencies in these procedures or in compliance that require urgent rectification will be addressed immediately by the MLRO, who will report such incidents to the Board as appropriate.
en.kap326: It will also request the Board to provide it with all necessary support.
en.kap327: The MLRO will audit the procedure directly, at least annually. The MLRO will also report its findings to the Board of Directors.
en.kap329: ✓ a summary of any changes in the regulatory environment(s) in which Europa777 operates.
en.kap330: ✓ a summary of AML activities within the company, including the number of internal suspicion reports received by the MLRO and the number of disclosures made to the Authorities.
en.kap331: ✓ details of any compliance deficiencies on which action has already been taken, along with reports of the results.
en.kap332: ✓ details of any compliance deficiencies on which actions need to be taken, along with recommended actions, including suggested timeline and required management support.

en.kap334: Where to provide your feedback and timeline of when the necessary action will be taken. When management action is indicated, the Board of Directors will request it.
en.kap335: This procedure will be reviewed and updated at least every six months. However, this may occur more frequently if changes in legislation or guidelines are introduced at any time, or if needed.
en.pp2: This Privacy Notice describes how Europa777 ('Europa777', 'We', 'Us', 'Our' or 'Company', as appropriate) collects, uses, stores, shares or maintains your personal information when you use our services through our website and mobile application.
en.pp3: It also describes your data protection rights, including the right to object to some of the processing we do.
en.pp4: The data controller for your personal information is:
en.pp5: In this Privacy Policy, you can learn about:
en.pp6: Your Agreement to the Privacy Policy
en.pp10: Use of information and legal basis
en.pp20: We encourage you to read the Privacy Policy carefully and use it to make informed decisions. By visiting Company websites, mobile applications or other online properties, or creating an account through our Services, you indicate that you have read and understand this Privacy Policy.
en.pp21: 1. Your Agreement to the Privacy Policy
en.pp22: Agreement: By using the Service, you ('User' or 'you') agree to the terms of this Privacy Policy which may be changed by Us from time to time, except as We may separately request. When you provide Us with your data, you consent to receive promotional communications from: (a) Us; and also (b) third party providers of goods and services with whom we may share your data.
en.pp23: We may change this Privacy Policy from time to time. Any change will be effective immediately upon notice of such change being posted on the Sites. We therefore recommend that you visit this Privacy Policy from time to time to make sure you are aware of the current version and any changes we may make.
en.pp25: We collect two types of information from our users:
en.pp27: The first type of information we collect is information that identifies or can identify itself by reasonable individual effort ('Personal Information'). The Personal Information being collected may consist of the following:
en.pp28: Account Details: when you open an account and register to use the Services, you will be asked to provide us with certain details about yourself, such as: first and last name, email address, gender, date of birth, personal number and code, age, physical address, identification number, tax code, telephone number and occupation.
en.pp29: In addition, we may collect certain information as required by various gaming regulations, as well as Know Your Customer ('KYC') and Anti-Money Laundering ('AML') regulatory requirements, such as your source of funds.
en.pp30: Government Issued ID: In some cases, you may be asked to provide a copy of a government issued ID for the identity verification process. Please note that this information is required for certain features of our Services.
en.pp31: Gambling Information: In order for us to provide you with the Services, we automatically record different information related to your account and use of our Services, including in relation to your transactions, deposits, balances, wagers, withdrawals, bonuses and winnings. We also collect information about potential problem or addiction gambling, based on your patterns of gambling on our Services, in order to ensure a responsible gaming environment and as required by law.
en.pp32: Financial Information: In order for you to take advantage of all the features of the Services (e.g. place bets, make purchases, play in tournaments, etc), payment information will be collected, such as your currency, credit card number, payment method, and bank account details.
en.pp33: Voluntary Information: We also collect information that you provide to us voluntarily, such as information provided by our VIP customers.
en.pp34: For example, when you respond to communications from us, by email or by sharing additional information about yourself through your use of the Services, such as in the chat feature and in games.
en.pp35: This includes information you wish to share with us for the purpose of improving and developing our relationship with you, as well as to maintain your evaluation of our Services (for example, information about your marital and family status, your hobbies and interests and other information you share with us through surveys).
en.pp36: Device Information: We collect specific types of connection details and information regarding your device, software or hardware that can identify you, such as: unique device identifiers (e.g., UDID, IMEI, and MAC address), browser fingerprint, IP Address, and geolocation data.
en.pp37: Phone calls: we record or monitor phone calls for customer support, training, and/or security purposes.
en.pp38: Phone calls: we record or monitor phone calls for customer support, training, and/or security purposes.
en.pp39: When photos and videos are taken in which you appear as an attendee, speaker, sponsor or exhibitor, we may use these photos and videos for promotional purposes. We may also use your interview for promotional purposes (we quote you).
en.pp40: Social Networking: When you register through your social network account (such as your Facebook account) to use the Services or connect your player account to such account, we will have access to basic information from your social network account, such as your name, date of birth, profile picture and friend list, as well as information that you have made publicly available in such account.
en.pp41: In addition, when using the Services, you may, through your social network, 'Invite a friend' to use the Services
en.pp42: If the person accepts your invitation, we may obtain personal information from him/her such as: name, email address, phone number, and date of birth. We will use Personal Information for the purposes set forth herein and will only disclose such information to third parties as detailed in this Privacy Policy.
en.pp43: Information We Collect From Third Parties: We collect Personal Information from third party service providers, such as information about your credit history from credit bureaus and other financial information relevant to the provision of the Services, as well as information that is collected to verify your identity and prevent fraudulent or illegal activity.
en.pp45: The second type of information is unidentified and non-personally identifiable information belonging to a User(s) that may be made available or collected through the User's use of the Services ('Non-Personal Information').
en.pp46: The Non-Personal Information that is being collected consists of aggregate technical and usage information and may contain, among other things, the User's operating system: browser type, screen resolution, browser and keyboard language, 'click stream' and activity on the Services, the length of time the User visited the Services and related time stamps, etc.
en.pp47: For the avoidance of doubt, any Non-Personal Information connected or linked to any Personal Information shall be deemed Personal Information as long as such connection or link exists.
en.pp48: Types of non-personal information we collect from or about you:
en.pp49: Login History and Technical Information: To enhance the functionality of the Services and provide you with a better user experience, we collect technical information transmitted by your device, including certain software and hardware information (e.g., the type of browser and operating system your device uses, language preference, access time and domain name of the website from which you linked to the Services; etc).
en.pp50: Game Information: We may record game play information including, but not limited to, your deposits, wagers, bonuses, game session length, and your high scores. We may also share and publish this information on any of our Platforms.
en.pp51: Device and Connection Information: We collect information from the specific device you are using for security and fraud detection and prevention purposes.
en.pp52: For example, we may collect information about other software that is running simultaneously with the Software - to detect if you are using any software associated with fraudulent activity (e.g. bots, malware, etc.) or to check if the connection you are using is via VPN or proxy.
en.pp53: Analytics Information: We collect information about your use of the Services, such as application usage, login files, user activity (e.g. pages viewed, amount of time spent on specific pages, online browsing, click, actions, etc.), date/time stamps, alerts, etc.
en.pp54: This information is collected, among other things, for troubleshooting errors and bugs, as well as for research and analysis purposes regarding your use of the Services.
en.pp55: Anonymous Information: We may anonymize or de-identify information collected through the Services or through other means so that the information cannot, by itself, personally identify you.
en.pp56: Our use and disclosure of such aggregated or de-identified information is not subject to any restrictions under this Privacy Policy, and we may disclose it to others without limitation and for any purpose, such as advertising or marketing.
en.pp58: Conditions: We will process your information for various reasons, each of them prescribed by the relevant data protection laws.
en.pp60: Our processing of your personal information will be primarily necessary for us to provide the Service.
en.pp61: Occasionally, we may ask for your consent to process personal information in a discrete manner, in which case your personal information will be processed in accordance with such consent and you may revoke your consent in writing at any time.
en.pp62: As an example, your consent will be required to send you marketing communications and promotions. Please note that we will not share your data with companies outside our company for them to use for their own marketing purposes.
en.pp63: Fulfilling a contract, fulfilling a legal obligation
en.pp64: We may also be required to process your personal information when necessary for the performance of a contract or to comply with our various legal and/or regulatory responsibilities, including, but not limited to, complying with the terms of our gaming licenses and complying with any anti-money laundering legislation.
en.pp66: Finally, we may also process your personal information when we consider that such processing is in our (or a third party's) legitimate interest and provided that such processing does not adversely affect your interests, rights and freedoms.
en.pp67: Examples of processing pursuant to legitimate interests include:
en.pp68: (i) when we disclose your personal information following a restructuring or for internal administrative purposes;
en.pp69: (ii) when we identify certain companies that may offer you additional benefits to our Service or provide us with valuable information about your use of our Service;
en.pp70: (iii) detection and retention of information relating to persons with responsible gambling problems. Please note that if you self-exclude yourself on any of our Sites for responsible gambling reasons, such restrictions may be extended or replicated on accounts you may have with Europa777;
en.pp71: (iv) processing for purposes of ensuring network and information security, including preventing access to our electronic communications network;
en.pp72: (v) safeguarding the integrity of the sport by combating suspicious betting patterns, and reporting and sharing information related to such patterns;
en.pp73: (vi) meeting regulatory and statutory requirements; (vii) designing a customized reward scheme for players.
en.pp75: The Services are not designed for or directed at persons under the age of 18 ('The Legal Age of 18').
en.pp76: If you are not of legal age, you should not download or use the Services or provide any Personal Information to us.
en.pp77: We reserve the right to access and verify any personal information collected from you. In the event that we become aware that a user who is not of legal age has shared any information, we may discard such information unless necessary to fulfill any legal or statutory obligation binding on us.
en.pp78: If you have any reason to believe that a minor has shared any information with us, please contact us.

en.pp179: By law, you have several rights when it comes to your information. You can exercise any of these rights by contacting us using our contact information below. You can exercise any of these rights by contacting us using our contact information below.
en.pp180: The right to object to processing. You have the right to object to certain types of processing, including processing for direct marketing.
en.pp181: The right to be informed. You have the right to receive clear, transparent and easily understandable information about how we use your information and your rights.
en.pp182: Right of Access. You have the right to obtain access to your information (if we are processing it) and certain other information (similar to that provided in this Privacy Policy).
en.pp184: You have the right to have your information corrected if it is inaccurate or incomplete.
en.pp185: You may request that we rectify any errors in the information we maintain.
en.pp186: The right to erasure. This is also known as 'the right to be forgotten' and, in simple terms, allows you to request the deletion or removal of your information that we hold. This right is not absolute and will not apply where legitimate and compelling reasons apply.
en.pp187: The right to restrict processing. You have the right to 'block' or suppress further use of your information.
en.pp188: When processing is restricted, we may still store your information, but we will no longer use it.
en.pp190: You have rights to obtain and reuse your information for your own purposes across different services.
en.pp191: However, this is not a general right and there are exceptions.
en.pp192: The right to lodge a complaint.
en.pp193: You have the right to lodge a complaint about the way we handle or process your information with your national data protection regulator. See the How to contact us section below.
en.pp194: The right to withdraw consent. If you have given your consent to anything we do with your information, you can withdraw your consent to the processing of your information at any time.

en.pp200: If we cannot resolve your questions or concerns, you also have the right to seek legal recourse before a national court.

en.nrg7: We do not allow anyone under the age of 18 to play poker games on Europa777. It is an offense for minors to participate in gambling activities.
en.nrg8: Our platform is not designed to attract children or teens. We actively discourage and track people under the age of 18 who attempt to play on our sites. We use sophisticated verification systems that can identify minors who attempt to log into our software.
en.nrg9: Europa777 reserves the right to request proof of age from any customer and may suspend an account until proper verification is received.
en.nrg10: However, we recognize that the Internet is easily accessible in many homes around the world. As a result, game companies and parents must work together to protect children from underage gambling.
en.nrg11: To ensure the safety of your children, we recommend that you install filtering software to prevent minors from accessing certain websites and programs.
en.nrg12: Most people consider gambling as a hobby and are in complete control of their actions. However, there are a minority of gamers who are more susceptible to addiction, creating problems that affect their lives and the lives of those close to them.
en.nrg13: Often, these gamers are not aware that they have a problem, as gaming addiction leaves no physical signs like those found in cases of drug or alcohol addiction.
en.nrg14: Gambling can be fun and profitable. But you can't always win. Losing is part of the game, and you have to be prepared for it. Therefore, you should play responsibly and not risk money that you cannot afford to lose.
en.nrg15: Gambling can also be addictive and make you lose perspective on time and money. We want all your gambling experiences to be as positive as possible, even if you lose. Therefore, we work hard to help you take control of your own gambling.
en.nrg17: Gambling is a form of entertainment. It is not a way to get rich quick and pay your debts.
en.nrg18: Gambling is a game of chance. There are no formulas that guarantee gains.
en.nrg19: Make sure that it is your decision to play.
en.nrg20: Never try to chase your losses.
en.nrg21: Check the amounts you regularly spend at the Cashier.
en.nrg22: Make sure you know the rules of the games you play.
en.nrg23: Like many things, what is pleasant in moderation can be disastrous in excess.
en.nrg24: Europa777 is careful about the target audience, the content of advertising messages, and the type of promotions offered, so as not to deviate from a realistic view of gambling.
en.nrg25: All Europa777 personnel are trained and aware of the problems caused by excessive gambling, as well as the symptoms that allow for the detection of such behavior.
en.nrg26: E-mails from players or their entourage alerting customer support about excessive gambling habits are treated with high priority.
en.nrg28: Do not leave children unattended near your computer when the poker software is running. You should take special care to ensure that they do not access our services through their devices.
en.nrg29: Protect your gambling programs with password access.
en.nrg30: Do not allow anyone under the age of 18 to participate in any gambling activity.
en.nrg31: Keep your username, password and deposit method details out of reach of children.
en.nrg32: Educate your children about the legality and potential harm of underage gambling.
en.nrg33: Limit the amount of time your children spend online.
en.nrg34: Be especially careful about the use by minors of facilities such as mobile devices.

en.frtm1: Europa777 is committed to high standards of customer service and to fair and open conduct in its gambling operations.
en.frtm2: The outcome of the Poker, Casino and Live Casino products, which Europa777 makes available to its customers, is determined by a certified and audited random number generator, which operates at a high level of encryption and randomness to ensure fairness without exception and no human interference (“RNG”).
en.frtm3: The RNG is administered by Casino and Live Casino providers and each of them has gone through and passed external compliance testing. This ensures that the games, once integrated into our website, perform as expected in terms of user experience.
en.frtm4: The Return to Player (RTP) value is a theoretical calculation of the average / expected percentage return of the total money bet over a large number of game plays (e.g. hundreds of million games).
en.frtm5: While you can win a big amount or lose your bet in any single gameplay, the average return of a specific game played over a long period of time will approach the Theoretical RTP value.
en.frtm6: This theoretical value is calculated either via analytical methods (which often is possible for non-strategy-dependent games such as slots) or via computer simulations of those more complex or strategy-dependent games (e.g. blackjack, roulette etc.)
en.frtm7: For more information about the fairness of specific games, please visit the information section of the relevant game. If you are unable to find this information, please contact our Customer Care team who will assist you further.
en.frtm8: By playing Casino games on our website, you acknowledge and agree that our RNG will determine the outcome of the games you play and that you will accept the outcomes of all such games.
en.frtm9: In the event of a discrepancy between the result that appears on your device’s display and the game server, the result that appears on the game server will prevail. You further acknowledge and agree that our records will be conclusive in relation to any dispute arising out of your gaming activity on our website.
en.frtm10: For more info please contact our Customer Support team
en.Our cashback bonus has a very simple rul: Our cashback bonus has a very simple rule: the more you deposit, the more you get back! Enjoy up to 20% cashback that is credited every single day.
en.Cashback is given on the deposit amount: Cashback is given on the deposit amount during the previous day from 00:00 to 23:59(UTC). The total amount of received cashback cannot exceed 20% of the total amount of all Players deposits.
en.Cashback is credited to the Player's acc: Cashback is credited to the Player's account automatically every day at 02:00 AM (UTC).
en.The maximum amount of cashback that can: The maximum amount of cashback that can be credited to the Player's account is 20% of the total amount of all deposits made by the Player during the previous day.
en.Wager requirement for cashback bonus is: Wager requirement for cashback bonus is x3.
en.Validity of the cashback is 3 days from: Validity of the cashback is 3 days from its receipt and 7 days after its activation.
en.Cashback will not be credited if the rea: Cashback will not be credited if the real money loss for the previous day was less than BTC 0.0008 / BCH 0.13 / DOGE 250 / ETH 0.013 / LTC 0.30 / USDT 20 / XRP 33 / TRX 250 / ADA 33 / BNB 0.067 / USDC 20 / BUSD 20.
en.You must have no pending withdrawals in: You must have no pending withdrawals in order to claim Daily Cashback
en.Any abuse in order to obtain a cashback: Any abuse in order to obtain a cashback bonus is prohibited; in particular, the use of the opposite bets strategy in table games is prohibited (e.g. simultaneous betting on both red and black in roulette, or other similar bet types).
en.For successful withdrawal of funds gaine: For successful withdrawal of funds gained with a cashback bonus, the Player must meet the wagering requirement for the total amount of deposits made during the day of at least three (3) times (i.e. total wager amount equals the amount of deposits for the day multiplied by 3) no later than 23:59 UTC of the day on which these deposits were made.
en.In the case of detection of the cashback: In the case of detection of the cashback bonus rules abuse or failure to comply with the wagering requirements specified in paragraph 8 of these rules, the Casino may cancel and seize all winnings gained with an active cashback bonus, as well as to confiscate an amount equal to the amount of cashback bonus received.

en.rg7: under the influence of alcohol or any other substance.
en.rg8: 2. Give yourself a set amount of time to play and limit yourself to that amount of time whether you win or lose.
en.rg9: 3. Do not rely on gambling as a source of income or to chase your losses.
en.rg10: 4. Don't let gambling interfere with other aspects of your daily life.
en.rg11: 5. Set yourself limits within your means, both for buying and for losses, before you start.

es.kap3: Es política de Europa777 que todos los miembros del personal participen activamente para evitar que los servicios de Europa777 sean explotados por delincuentes y terroristas con fines de lavado de dinero o utilizados para financiar una actividad terrorista a través de ganancias obtenidas mediante apuestas en el sitio web de la empresa.
es.kap4: Esta participación tiene los siguientes objetivos:
es.kap5: garantizar el cumplimiento de Europa777 con todas las leyes aplicables, los instrumentos reglamentarios y los requisitos del organismo de supervisión correspondiente proteger a la empresa y a todos sus empleados como individuos de los riesgos asociados con las violaciones de la ley, los reglamentos y los requisitos de supervisión preservar el buen nombre de Europa777 contra el riesgo de daño a la reputación que presenta la participación en actividades de lavado de dinero y financiamiento del terrorismo contribuir positivamente a la lucha contra el crimen y el terrorismo.
es.kap6: Para lograr estos objetivos, la política de Europa777 es que:
es.kap7: todo empleado debe cumplir con sus obligaciones personales según corresponda a su función y cargo en la empresa.
es.kap8: Las consideraciones comerciales nunca prevalecerán sobre los compromisos contra el blanqueo de capitales de Europa777.
es.kap9: la empresa nombrará un oficial de denuncias de lavado de dinero (MLRO) y un miembro del personal designado para brindar continuidad durante su ausencia, y contará con la asistencia y cooperación total de todos los miembros del personal en el desempeño de las funciones de sus nombramientos.
es.kap10: Cualquier referencia al MLRO en este documento deberá incluir al miembro del personal designado en caso de que el MLRO esté temporalmente ausente.
es.kap12: Europa777 considera que antes de implementar su Procedimiento de Gestión del Fraude, es fundamental identificar qué es, por un lado, el blanqueo de capitales, y qué, por otro lado, constituye la financiación del terrorismo.
es.kap13: El blanqueo de capitales es el movimiento o la ocultación del producto del delito para encubrir la conexión entre el delito y los fondos generados, a fin de beneficiarse del producto del delito. Por lo tanto, el objetivo final es encubrir el origen de los fondos.
es.kap14: El financiamiento del terrorismo es el proceso de proporcionar fondos u otros activos, directa o indirectamente, a grupos terroristas o terroristas individuales para apoyarlos en sus operaciones.
es.kap15: Esto puede ocurrir a través de fondos de fuentes legítimas o una combinación de fuentes legales e ilegales.
es.kap16: De hecho, el financiamiento de fuentes legales es una diferencia clave entre las organizaciones terroristas y las organizaciones criminales tradicionales involucradas en operaciones de lavado de dinero.
es.kap17: Si bien parece lógico que no sea necesario lavar la financiación procedente de fuentes legítimas, a menudo existe la necesidad de que los terroristas encubran o disimulen los vínculos entre la organización, o el terrorista individual, y sus fuentes legítimas de financiación.
es.kap18: 2. El enfoque basado en el riesgo
es.kap20: De acuerdo con las leyes aplicables, Europa777 adopta un enfoque basado en el riesgo.
es.kap21: Así, identifica y analiza sus riesgos y posteriormente hace uso de medidas, políticas, controles y procedimientos para frenar los riesgos no deseados, entre los que se materializan los relacionados con los riesgos de blanqueo de capitales y financiación del terrorismo.
es.kap22: El enfoque permite que Europa777 ejerza una gran flexibilidad y discrecionalidad.
es.kap23: Eso en sí mismo implica una responsabilidad significativa.
es.kap24: Corresponde a Europa777 demostrar a través de la documentación adecuada, incluido, entre otros, un proceso de análisis de riesgos, que ha evaluado todos los riesgos e implementado adecuadamente todas las medidas para controlar esos riesgos.
es.kap25: En este sentido, esta política establece los pasos específicos que Europa777 tomará para asegurar que su conducta está alineada con el Enfoque Basado en Riesgos con respecto a la consideración e identificación de riesgos que afectan directamente al lavado de dinero y financiamiento del terrorismo.
es.kap28: (i) reconocimiento de la existencia del riesgo
es.kap29: (ii) llevar a cabo una evaluación de riesgos, y
es.kap30: (iii) implementar sistemas y estrategias para gestionar y controlar los riesgos identificados.
es.kap31: No hay duda de que el negocio de las apuestas a distancia se considera arriesgado.
es.kap32: No obstante, la evaluación de riesgos identificará los principales riesgos a los que se enfrenta la empresa, así como el nivel de dichos riesgos, de manera que en consecuencia se puedan tomar las medidas necesarias para gestionar y controlar los riesgos identificados.
es.kap33: Este procedimiento especificará los controles y procesos que se deben seguir para asegurar que los riesgos que Europa777 ha identificado y enfrentará como parte de sus operaciones no se materializan.
es.kap34: La evaluación de riesgos organizativos de Europa777, que debe ser aprobada por el Consejo de Administración, tiene en cuenta los siguientes factores:
es.kap36: Algunos productos/servicios/transacciones de juegos son más vulnerables a la explotación criminal que otros. Estos incluyen, por ejemplo, productos o servicios de juegos que permiten que un cliente influya en el resultado de un juego, ya sea un jugador solo o en connivencia con otros.
es.kap38: Hace referencia al canal a través del cual Europa777 establece una relación comercial y/o a través del cual se realizan transacciones.
es.kap39: Las interacciones no presenciales, como en el caso de la interfaz empresarial Europa777, ya no se consideran automáticamente de alto riesgo, siempre que se adopten medidas y controles tecnológicos para hacer frente al alto riesgo de suplantación de identidad o suplantación de identidad.
es.kap40: Europa777 adoptará una buena combinación de métodos de verificación basados en documentos y fuentes electrónicas, como se menciona a continuación, para contrarrestar los riesgos mencionados.
es.kap41: Por ejemplo, aunque Europa777 hace uso de bases de datos electrónicas, es consciente de que las bases de datos solo confirman que los datos de identificación proporcionados corresponden a los de una persona real, y no que el cliente sea realmente ese individuo.
es.kap42: Proporcionar documentos de identificación adicionales proporcionará una prueba más de que Europa777 estaba justificado al considerar que el Cliente es, de hecho, la persona que dice ser.
